alert.note: Alert for Mercer (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 11:35PM EST until January 10 at 1:45PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Assunpink Creek At Trenton affecting Mercer County. For the Assunpink Creek...including Trenton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Assunpink Creek at Trenton. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Assunpink Park floods. George Page Park floods. Minor street flooding in Trenton. At 9.0 feet, Mulberry Street begins to flood. At 10.0 feet, Mulberry Street flooding increases. Evacuations possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage and to a crest of 9.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 09/08/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Assunpink Creek Trenton 8.5 7.5 Tue 11 p 6.7 5.3 9.2 1am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1145 AM EST.
